Topic.Title: AMZN's Q3 revenue beat

Message.Msg: Once again you deflect because you have no capacity for critical thought. Let's start with some basics. Costco charges $55 for a basic membership and $110 for one with a 2% rebate on purchases. What is the breakeven level of purchase activity for the Exective membership? How much does Costco make if a member purchases nothing? What about if someone (regular member) buys $55 worth of stuff every week (assuming Costco average gross margins)? Now, look at Amazon. Prime includes hunlimited free movies (so take proxy for content share of T&C and divide by estimated Prime members to figure out average content cost). Now, net profit per customer does that o$55 once per week order of goods (shipped for free 2 day shipping) give you? Keep arguing that Prime and Costco memberships are the same... This is a growth ponzi on many levels, where those buying it haven't realized that the "inflation" they are hedging hurts Amazon rather than helping it.

Topic.Title: AMZN's Q3 revenue beat

Message.Msg: Once again you evade explaining how you produce anyting but a huge loss in your shorting of this stock. “Let's start with some basics.” Good idea. Both programs make a trade off between pricing (both of fees and of products) and margins. If this were not true, Costoc fees would be higher and their deep discounts on products would not exist. “Amazon. Prime includes hunlimited free movies” No,it does not. Their is a limitation. Hardly any of the must see programming is on offer. A lot of it is old shows used as marketing like a preview so that those who are not tight wads (you, maybe) pay for streaming more recent shows. It is essentially the same thing as Costco offering a deeper discount on an older dvd than a new release. So no essential difference there. “net profit per customer...” Well you did not really demonstrate that here in the first place and it was not the main issue of this thread either but merely a tactic on your part of going down some irrelevant tangent along the lines of Amazon MIGHT not be making a short-term profit on this or that initiative right now so it isn’t worth doing. Now please stop trying to evade this issue and show us your model for how you will dig yourself out of the deep hole of that $120 per share loss on your Amazon short.
